kernfrasen: The name of the Lord is a fortified tower
The wealth of the rich is their fortified city
a wall too high to scale
The more you sow and scatter your grain
Jesus Christ was rich... yet became poor

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: The name of the Lord is a fortified tower; the righteous run to it and are safe.

cognitieve_implicaties: The world is inherently dangerous and unstable.
Safety requires active movement toward a specific location.
theologische_implicaties: God's 'Name' (attributes) is the only objective reality that provides ontological security.
ethische_implicaties: The believer must choose where to 'dwell' mentally during crises.
onbedoelde_consequenties: Could imply a 'bunker mentality' or isolation from the world.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher revitalizes the dead metaphor of 'God is a rock' by detailing the historical dangers of ancient extra-mural life (marauders, dust storms).

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The sermon successfully bridges the Architectural domain (Security) with the Economic domain (Identity) by showing how money attempts to function as a 'city'.

incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: The preacher uses 'scattering' as both an agricultural act (sowing) and a physical destruction (Jesus' body broken).
incoherentie_punten.entailment_conflict: Sowing seed is a controlled, hopeful act; being 'broken to pieces' (Jesus) is a violent, involuntary-looking act.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: Jesus as the 'Ultimate Treasure' who pays the price, shifting the focus from what the believer pays to what the Savior paid.

sterktes.beschrijving: Re-activating the 'City' metaphor by explaining ancient sociology.
sterktes.voorbeeld: Outside of cities, you had wild animals, wind and dust storms...

risicos.beschrijving: The 'Sow and Reap' metaphor risks being heard as Prosperity Gospel.
risicos.voorbeeld: The more you give away, the more you get.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Hearers might give money as a calculated investment for financial return.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: An ancient Near Eastern landscape with walled cities and dangerous wilderness.
sub_worlds: The modern financial world (accounting, ROI, Kindle books)
The scene of the Crucifixion (nails, splintering bones)

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: High; creates a sense of historical weight for the concept of 'security'.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: Used as one of the four 'walls' of the Name of the Lord.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Personifying money as a 'seductive' entity that offers to be a god.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Fits the year-end giving cycle and Advent preparation.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is built on a sophisticated contrast between the 'Fortified City of Wealth' and the 'Fortified Tower of God'. It moves from the Architectural to the Agrarian, and finally to the Somatic (the broken body of Christ).

revitalisatie_suggesties.doel_metafoor: Washed in the blood / Broken for us
revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Deepen the physical source domain of 'scattering'.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: The bones crunched and splintered as they drove the nails...

coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Explicitly clarify that the 'fruit' of generosity is character and community, not more 'seed' (money).

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: If money is a god, humans are its slaves.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Emphasize the 'demotion' of money to 'just money' more clearly.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To address the 'hollowing out' of character as a pathology.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in using CMT to expose the cognitive architecture of idolatry.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: Focuses on how 'Fortified City' functions as a cognitive map for security rather than just a poetic image.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Moves beyond 'experience' to the underlying conceptual mappings of the hearer's worldview.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: Identifies that the 'Day of Wrath' is mapped as a 'Force' that the 'Fortress' must withstand.

appendices.notities: The preacher uses 'scattering' as a bridge between agrarian generosity and the substitutionary atonement.
